pageContext.description: In two pieces; point missing. 1 rivet-hole broken out. Flat triangular dagger, with grooves parallel to edges, six rivet holes with five rivets remaining.
pageContext.associations: Found with flat celt, No. 1, two gold ornaments and flat triangular dagger, No. 25, with one fragment of a wooden sheath, a sandstone amulet, a fragment of a third dagger and cremated bones.
pageContext.site: England,Dorset,Upwey,Barrow on Ridge (No. 7),Found in the fourth interment in Mr. John May's barrow on the Ridgeway, near Upwey, opened August 1886.
pageContext.toSearch: Upwey, Weymouth, Weymouth, Dorset Dt3, UK
pageContext.remarks: Owning to the way that it has been fixed in the case, it proved impossible to take accurate measurements or make an accurate drawing.
